topic.title: Python SDK 2.0
topic.shortdesc: The Couchbase Python client allows you to connect to a Couchbase cluster from Python.

body.note: This document is for the 2.x version of the Python SDK. If you are not using the 2.x version, please refer to the Python SDK 1.2 documentation.
body.p: The Couchbase Python client is written as a fast C extension with support for a traditional synchronous API, as well as gevent and twisted APIs for high performance asynchronous programming.
Here's a sampling of what you can do with the Couchbase Python SDK:

section.title: Connecting
section.p: To connect to a bucket, just import the Bucket class from the couchbase.bucket package. The Bucket object represents a connection to a Couchbase bucket. To instantiate the bucket object, pass it the location of the cluster and the bucket you with to connect to. The following shows how to connect to a bucket on localhost.
section.codeblock: from couchbase.bucket import Bucket bucket = Bucket('couchbase://localhost/default')

section.title: Performing Queries
section.p: In addition to the basic operations that are available, more methods are provided to perform queries against your data. These queries allow you to ask questions like "What beers start with A?" rather than simply "Give me the beer that is called Aaas_Frankl." This is possible through the use of the Couchbase MapReduce views engine. The following is an example of performing a view query:
section.codeblock: for row in bucket.query('beer', 'by_name', limit=3): print row
